results.display_title: Streit’s: Matzo and the American Dream
results.headline: Review: Streit’s Matzo, a New York Tale of a Lost Love
results.summary_short: Michael Levine’s earnest but plodding film chronicles the closing of a Lower East Side factory that had held a vital role in the neighborhood since 1925.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Streit’s: Matzo and the American Dream

results.headline: Review: ‘13 Cameras,’ Keeping a Watchful Eye and Then Some
results.summary_short: A creepy landlord, a father-to-be with a wandering eye, and a lot more than a couple bargained for in renting a home.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 13 Cameras

results.headline: Review: ‘Our Last Tango’ Celebrates Two Virtuosos of the Form
results.summary_short: German Kral’s documentary is a portrait of the dancers María Nieves and Juan Carlos Copes, leading tango performers for almost 50 years.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Our Last Tango

results.headline: Review: ‘Barbershop: The Next Cut’: Let the Debates Resume
results.summary_short: This movie revives the “Barbershop” franchise, bringing back Ice Cube as the owner of a haircutting establishment on Chicago’s South Side.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Barbershop: The Next Cut

results.headline: Review: In ‘Sky,’ a Woman Takes Refuge Among Strangers
results.summary_short: A woman who lives in Paris and is visiting the United States with her husband flees to Las Vegas after he drunkenly tries to rape her in their motel room.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sky

results.headline: Review: ‘Sing Street’ Is an ’80s Love Affair, Hair Gel Required
results.summary_short: The film, directed by John Carney, who also directed ‘Once,’ is a tribute to the decade of hair gel and rock ’n’ roll.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sing Street

results.headline: Review: In ‘New York, New York,’ Job Opportunities Complicate a Relationship
results.summary_short: In this film from Luo Dong, a man and a woman wrestle with the question of leaving China or remaining there.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of New York, New York

results.headline: Review: ‘Above and Below’ a Study of People on the Margins
results.summary_short: This documentary visits primarily transients in Las Vegas and the California desert, and a participant in an earnest Mars research project.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Above and Below

results.headline: Review: In ‘An Eye for Beauty,’ Gorgeous People Suffer, Too
results.summary_short: A married man succumbs to the charms of a predatory about-to-be-divorced beauty who bluntly propositions him within minutes of their meeting.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of An Eye for Beauty

results.headline: Review: ‘The Adderall Diaries,’ a Sprawl of Unreliable Memories
results.summary_short: A narcissistic writer has a fraught reunion with his father and spins out of control in Pamela Romanowsky’s take on Stephen Elliott’s memoir.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Adderall Diaries

results.headline: Review: In ‘Criminal,’ You Must Remember This
results.summary_short: In Ariel Vromen’s action film, Kevin Costner plays a convict with an altered brain used to capture a C.I.A. officer’s memories.

results.headline: Review: ‘Colonia’ Looks at a Dark Period in South American History
results.summary_short: A flight attendant is enjoying a glossy stopover in Chile with a German living there, when the 1973 Pinochet coup sweeps them up.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Measure of a Man,’ a Tale of a Man’s Lost Labor
results.summary_short: Vincent Lindon, who won a the best actor award at Cannes for his role, stars as an alienated security guard in this film from Stéphane Brizé.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Wedding Doll,’ Search, and Struggle, to Find Independence and Romance
results.summary_short: Nitzan Gilady’s fiction feature debut centers on a young woman with a mild mental disability in search of her own way.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wedding Doll

results.headline: Review: ‘Echo Park,’ the Story of an Early Romance
results.summary_short: A woman who is coming off a long-term relationship meets a man who has seen his American dream fade and has decided to return to his native England.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Echo Park

results.headline: Review: Recycled ‘Jungle Book’ Puts a Real Boy in a Forest of Pixels
results.summary_short: This Disney redo, by Jon Favreau, is a live-action movie that’s heavy on C.G.I. and a sunny vibe borrowed from the 1967 original.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Green Room,’ a Scruffy Comic Flavor Turns Tense
results.summary_short: A punk band booked at a roadhouse whose patrons are skinheads unleashes a cover of the Dead Kennedys’ anthem insulting “Nazi punks.” Trouble ensues.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Green Room

results.headline: Review: ‘My Big Night,’ a Dark Farce Juggling Behind-the-Scenes Dramas
results.summary_short: Álex de la Iglesia’s comedy, set at the filming of a New Year’s Eve television special, deals with murder, blackmail, riots, jealousy and a crane crash.

results.headline: Review: ‘Rio, I Love You,’ Stories That Make Up a Mash Note to a City
results.summary_short: The directors of this anthology film, a paean to Rio de Janeiro, include Paolo Sorrentino, Guillermo Arriaga and Im Sang-soo.

results.headline: Review: ‘The First Monday in May’ Goes Behind the Scenes at the Met
results.summary_short: This documentary looks at the creation of the 2015 exhibition “China: Through The Looking Glass” and the benefit that coincides with its opening.
